poem:
**Puzzle Morning**

Between black squares   
and white, the Sunday print   
waits—   
tiny intersections of thought.

Letters fit and   shift,   
a mosaic of words   
born in silence.   

In the kitchen, coffee steams—   
a quiet corner   
of sunlight,    

hints buried deep    
as ours unravel,   
one clue at a time.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Weekend crossword No 729". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
